episodeTitleJapanese: 伝説の一族！うそつきノーランド
description: The Straw Hat Pirates encounter Mont Blanc Cricket, a descendant of the legendary explorer Mont Blanc Noland. Cricket reveals the tragic story of his ancestor who discovered a city of gold but was executed as a liar when the king found only jungle. Cricket agrees to help the crew reach Sky Island to restore his family's honor.

events.title: Mont Blanc Cricket's Debut
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates encounter Mont Blanc Cricket for the first time when he suddenly emerges from underwater diving. Cricket shoots at the crew but collapses from decompression sickness before any real conflict begins.
events.significance: Introduces a crucial ally who will help the Straw Hats reach Sky Island and reveals the connection to the legendary Mont Blanc Noland story that becomes central to the Sky Island Saga.

events.title: The Legend of Noland the Liar
events.description: Cricket reveals the tragic story of his ancestor Mont Blanc Noland, who 400 years ago discovered a city of gold on Jaya Island. When Noland returned with the king and 2,000 soldiers, they found only jungle. Noland was executed as a liar, though he insisted the gold city had sunk into the sea.
events.significance: Establishes the backstory that connects Jaya to Sky Island and sets up the emotional core of the Skypiea arc. Noland's story parallels themes of truth, dreams, and redemption that are central to One Piece.

quotes.text: The mountain of gold must have sunk into the sea!
quotes.speaker: Mont Blanc Noland
quotes.context: Noland's final words before his execution

events.title: Cricket's Connection to Noland Revealed
events.description: Cricket reveals that he is a direct descendant of Mont Blanc Noland and has dedicated his life to diving near Jaya to find proof of the city of gold, seeking to restore his ancestor's honor and his family's tarnished name.
events.significance: Establishes Cricket's motivation and explains why he has been searching the seas near Jaya. This personal quest for redemption makes Cricket a sympathetic character and creates emotional investment in the Sky Island journey.

events.title: Arrival at Cricket's Home
events.description: The Straw Hats arrive at Mont Blanc Cricket's house on the coast of Jaya, where Masira and Shoujou are caring for the collapsed Cricket. The house is filled with salvaged items from Cricket's diving expeditions.
events.significance: Establishes the base of operations for the Saruyama Alliance and provides a safe haven for the Straw Hats as they prepare for their journey to Sky Island.

events.title: Discovery of Noland's Logbook
events.description: Cricket shows the crew an ancient logbook from Mont Blanc Noland's expedition, which contains references to 'skyfish' and other hints that Sky Island actually exists. This provides crucial evidence that supports the legends of Sky Island.
events.significance: Provides tangible proof that Sky Island exists and validates the crew's decision to pursue it. The logbook becomes key evidence that Noland was telling the truth all along.

events.title: Cricket Agrees to Help the Straw Hats
events.description: After hearing about the crew's encounter with Bellamy and their determination to reach Sky Island, Cricket decides to help them. He agrees to guide them to the Knock Up Stream and prepare their ship for the dangerous journey.
events.significance: Solidifies the alliance between the Straw Hats and the Saruyama Alliance. This decision sets in motion the events that will lead the crew to Sky Island and eventually prove Noland's innocence.

events.title: Noland's Character Revealed
events.description: Cricket explains that Mont Blanc Noland was known as an extremely honest man who never lied, making his execution as a 'liar' particularly tragic. This revelation adds depth to the Noland legend and establishes him as a man of integrity.
events.significance: Reinforces the theme that Noland was telling the truth and makes his story more tragic. This characterization makes the eventual proof of Sky Island's existence more emotionally resonant.

events.title: Saruyama Alliance Dynamic Shown
events.description: The episode shows the relationship between Cricket, Masira, and Shoujou. The two monkey-themed pirates care deeply for Cricket and are dedicated to helping him achieve his dream of proving Noland's story.
events.significance: Establishes the bonds within the Saruyama Alliance and shows that they are united by belief in Noland's tale and loyalty to Cricket. This makes them reliable allies for the Straw Hats.

events.title: Mihawk Observes New Bounty Posters
events.description: In a brief scene, Dracule Mihawk is shown looking at the new bounty posters for Luffy and other pirates. This cameo appearance reminds viewers of Mihawk's interest in Zoro and the Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: Provides continuity with earlier arcs and reminds viewers that powerful figures in the world are taking notice of Luffy's growing reputation. Sets up future encounters.

quotes.text: The mountain of gold must have sunk into the sea!
quotes.speaker: Mont Blanc Noland
quotes.context: Noland's final words before execution, maintaining his story was true

quotes.text: I'm going to prove that my ancestor was telling the truth!
quotes.speaker: Mont Blanc Cricket
quotes.context: Cricket explaining his life's mission to the Straw Hats

themes.description: The episode explores the tragedy of being truthful but not believed, as Noland's honest account of the city of gold led to his execution. Cricket's quest to prove the truth mirrors the Straw Hats' own journey of pursuing seemingly impossible dreams.
themes.symbolism: The sunken city of gold represents truth that exists but cannot be seen, requiring faith and determination to uncover.

themes.description: Cricket carries the burden of his ancestor's tarnished reputation and seeks to restore the family honor. This theme resonates with the idea that one's actions can impact future generations.
themes.symbolism: Cricket's diving represents his descent into the past to bring truth to light and cleanse his family name.

themes.description: Despite being mocked and abandoned, Cricket continues his search for evidence of the city of gold. His dedication mirrors Luffy's unwavering pursuit of becoming Pirate King despite obstacles.
themes.symbolism: The endless diving and salvaging represents the persistent effort required to achieve one's dreams.

characterSpotlights.development: Cricket is introduced as a complex character carrying the weight of his ancestor's legacy. We learn about his dedication to proving Noland's story and his willingness to help others who believe in dreams.

Shares the story of Mont Blanc Noland

quotes: I'm going to prove that my ancestor was telling the truth!

characterSpotlights.development: Noland is revealed as a tragic hero who discovered truth but was executed for it. His character establishes the emotional stakes for the Sky Island arc.

Returned with the king but found only jungle

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his characteristic ability to believe in others' dreams and quickly decides to trust Cricket, recognizing a kindred spirit who pursues his goals despite mockery.
keyActions: Accepts Cricket's help to reach Sky Island

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some dialogue scenes between Cricket and the Straw Hats to provide more emotional context.
The Mihawk cameo scene at the end was slightly extended in the anime with additional shots of him examining the bounty posters.

trivia.fact: Mont Blanc Cricket's design includes a distinctive chestnut-shaped growth on his head, which is a hereditary trait from his ancestor Noland, who also had this feature.

sources.title: Mont Blanc Cricket - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode aired on March 16, 2003, during the Jaya Arc which serves as a prologue to the fan-favorite Skypiea Arc.
The story of Noland the Liar is based on a picture book that exists within the One Piece world, making him a legendary figure known throughout the seas.
This episode adapts chapters 227-228 of the manga, maintaining relatively close pacing to the source material.
The episode achieved an 11.9% TV rating in Japan and ranked 7th for its timeslot, showing strong viewership for this arc.
